creator: ofudd@speed-test.net
text:
Hi!

I'm all excited to try out the ftp support that mod_proxy mentions, but I don't
see how!  (ie: there is no example shown)

Possible resolutions:
1)  If it's a secret, maybe remove it from the documentation?
2)  If it's on a different page of the documentation, maybe mention that page?
3)  If it's just been overlooked, maybe add it?

Possible examples that could be put into the documentation:
1) How to turn Apache into an ftp server:
2) How to turn Apache into a proxy ftp server:

creator: ofudd@speed-test.net
text:
I suppose the change to the documentation will say that a user has to set their
ftp proxy settings (in their browser) to be port 80 (or whatever) on the proxy
server, and 'ProxyRequests On' has to be set in httpd.conf (plus security
restrictions).

Can Apache be a reverse ftp proxy?  It doesn't appear so.  Please mention that
in the documentation.

Thanks!

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
Marking this a "blocker" seems a little OTT.

It looks to me a lot like bug 9656.  Having seen these two reports, I'm going to
discuss it with the author of mod_ftpd, to explore whether that can work
together with mod_proxy, and if so what we can now support.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 9656 ***
